p: In the test with S. bicolor seeds, the germination percentage, at all tested concentrations, showed means close to the negative control (Fig. 2b). However, for GSI, the concentration of 3,000 ppm was similar to treatment with glyphosate. Root length was the most affected variable; all concentrations, except 187.5 ppm, inhibited root growth more than glyphosate did. For shoot length, significant inhibition was observed at the two highest concentrations.
